alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Owsley, southeastern Jackson and northeastern Clay Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bradshaw, or over McKee, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gray Hawk, Turkey Foot and Settle Store around 450 PM EDT. Privett, New Zion, Zekes Point, Mildred, Tyner, Welchburg and Egypt around 455 PM EDT. Green Hall, Elian, Mummie, Herd, Maulden and Wild Dog around 500 PM EDT. Sturgeon, Travellers Rest, Nathanton, Vincent and Sourwood around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Blake, Endee, Island City, Levi, Sextons Creek, Pebworth, Booneville, Major, Scoville, Turin, Thomas, Conkling, Southfork, Taff, Trixie, Eversole, Chestnut Gap, Teges, Felty, Ricetown, Gobbard, Sebastian, Cowcreek, Newfound, Lerose and Oneida. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
